My question, to the socially adept of us here, is - how do you socialize with people? How do you stay socially relevant while dealing with this problem? I find that it's just too difficult when conversation inevitably comes my way and people ask - how are you, what are you up to, how are you doing, etc. and all I have going on is my constant battle with addiction?

I have to start working again, but I'm not sure if I can wait till I'm off Kratom too. A part of me thinks getting on a routine would be good for me even if I have to eventually deal with Kratom W/Ds while working.

I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom. I would love to stop it all but I'm living alone and not working, not having a distraction or something to normalize my routine makes withdrawal 10x's worse.
I have dealing with this game for 2 months, I will not use for 3-4 days but would constantly relapse. ... This has to let up this week or I will break.

What can I do to make it thru detox without killing myself (or really wanting to).
Almost five days clean . I feel great all day, but I can't handle the wrestless legs at night. Tips please? I can't deal .
I feel alive for the first time in 10 yrs. I've been hitting meetings.
I have been suffering from chronic pain the majority of my life... Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad. How the fuck do I live like this.
I am scared bc I know I will want to use. I am scared bc I know I can walk into the er and get a shot of Dilaudid and a script for Vicodin.
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia...
I don't even remember how it's done. I am happy to be here, sober .
I've never been friends with another addict, but I am so damn lonely. This is just so tempting. Just for today, I will not relapse. What about tomorrow tho.
Not this year. I celebrated by not using.

Anyone down for a recovery fantasy league? I used to run one in r/opiates but figured I could get some people who actually could participate in the entire season through this sub.

I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe, was doing the “undercover ninja” every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life. ... But I’m able to deal and cope with it without loading up a shot of heroin to just push those feelings away for a few hours.
Nine Months...
I was making plans to go pick up [opiates] the second I got out...
I’m officially one year clean from opiates. Probably the biggest accomplishment of my life to say the least.

Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday. My last pill connect entered rehab last week. All ties are cut and I'm moving forward in my life.
Despite what stage you're in, just know that whatever time you have cleared, you never have to do that part again.
None
None
Waking up
One week down, working on day 8. So far I haven't been a huge crybaby like yesterday. Instead it's just a emotional void, no good or bad. I'll take that over just bad.
Eight days down, moving into day 9. Not as cool as r/The_Motel 's 112 but better than nothing.
10 down. Working on 11.

I'm still a lot of things that fuckin suck... BUT I'm noticing glimmers. Sometimes they come and go in an instant, sometimes they stick around a few minutes, sometimes I can stretch them for 1-2 hours. Piece by piece, glimmer by glimmer, I'm working to rebuild.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
Feeling sorta bleh this morning but it's all good.

I was talking to someone last night about how most of us do enough research to have PhDs in this shit. Sometimes I wish I had a simple tracked mind that didn't try to identify all the bullshit that takes place.
in hopes of pumping some natural feel good into my body
None
Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind. Sort of feels like I'm a more functional shell of myself... in a good way.
I immediately got up with one of my biggest supporters, played the tape of days 1-7, took some deep breaths (maybe smoked a bit of weed) and went on a jog with my dog.

Closing in on 3 weeks, Feeling better every day, looking forward to maybe sleeping in this weekend? Whatever the fuck that means. I'm waiting for that one night where I just conk out for 8-9 hours so bad.

Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats... Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats. Other than that it's a mental game at this point.

Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs. Hoping some of the above starts to clear out over the next week.
I felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves. I think it's gradually getting better but it feels sort of consistent over the last few days.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.
None
None
Hoping this is just a wave of bad to remind me where it started. Hoping for some reprieve going into the weekend.

I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would. I have an appetite. I'm moving to Beijing in a week so I will be away from all my old connects and friends, but the bad news? I may have lost the love of my life.
I've now gone five days without, and I can't help but think, fuck it, one more time, whats the big deal? Ill be gone soon anyway with no connects so what can happen??

Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore. It is humiliating. Degrading. I dont want in the least to be that person.

The day I ran out I called in sick, since it had been so long since I'd experienced WD I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up, I was so tired but couldn't even lay on my bed because the RLS would start up instantly.

I've tried to quit 5 times in the last year or so. Start a program, leave the program. Get through detox, feel great and then "just for the weekend" myself back into active addiction.
42 days. 42 god-blessed days.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. The days where I feel out of control and anxious are farther and farther apart.
I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.

I wanted to thank all of you who responded to my previous post and encourage anyone who may read this another day. We can do it, and it's not shameful to be afraid and work through that fear with others.

I'm not sure why, but as soon as I knew I really had a physical problem, as evidenced by imaging - I allowed myself some relief. My husband has the pills stashed, there were only 16 5mg Percocet given to me and I've only taken 6, total... if I had them, they would be 100% gone.
What am I supposed to do? I know that I am a fucking jackass when it comes to this shit, but it isn't until the evening when I realize I can't live this way.
Just as someone posted above- think about what kind of life you really, truly, want to have and maintain. Make it a realistic and achievable goal.
I encourage anyone who wants to make that change to realize that you already do know, in your heart, that you are fully capable of changing.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication (which the doctors often failed to warn about), the doc suddenly ends the script.

If someone who is on subs, methadone, or using, and has been wanting to jump off/get clean... I wonder if this situation would make it “easier” both physically and mentally, since you know you are going to feel that way regardless of using or not.

I just want to write this so that those who are in the state and/or timeframe that I was in at this point two years ago to know that it gets so, so much better. Unfortunately, time away from the game and everything involved with it is another very important factor and it feels unfair, because time is not something that we can manipulate (as we are all so well versed in doing one way or another) and b/c of that it is frustrating and almost can feel futile.

All of the literature is, for the most part is, super sober people saying the only way to do this is 100% straight, OR people thinking they thought could do it their way and being wrong. It makes me really sad to think I won't be able to go have a drink with friends, or go out on the weekends (without risk of relapse). Anyone else?

With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals. In some weird way, I wish I could sill drink or smoke or take other pills, and those suppressed longings are turning into something different.

I think I would wish for my own place. Living with my parents is alright, but I feel like it's holding me back from being independent (which I feel is an important part of recovery).
I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.

The whole one year rule is in the back of my mind. How can I expect someone to be where I need them to be, if I'm not where I need me to be? I've been talking to this REALLY REALLY hot 18 year old girl at meetings lately and I'm pretty sure she's feeling me.

I still feel like I'm missing something. I guess I am still addicted to chaos.
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years! I'm so happy that im able to spend the day with my family.

To anyone who is in early recovery, I want to tell you that it is possible to enjoy life without drugs. I didn't believe it was possible a few months ago but as time went on and I began going to meetings and realizing what life was really about was when I became happier.

Does anyone have any advice on something that can help me sleep without aggravating the RLS? I have been doing hot baths/shower, serious stretching before bed, trying not to eat anything as sometimes caffeine and sugar can make it worse.
I'm having a few potential issues I'm a bit worried about... Does anyone think this is related to the opiate quitting again?
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and wanted to post an update. ... Hoping I didn't do any permanent damage and it will come back.
I have the worst headache of my life achey and chilly, when I'm not feeling on fire. My guts also are, not great. I guess I forgot what getting sick is like? ... No thank you.
I've lived with depression since I was about 19 and have been on and off diff ssris and anti deppresents, and felt I had enough clean time to get a baseline intake done.
Throwing this out there for advice, encouragement, and the sense of community I craved and needed when first getting clean.

I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years. Made it through a pretty rough trigger, proud of myself .
To all you thinking of getting clean do it, you are loved, you are worth it.
It's like ice picks in my brain. The pain is incredible.
I'm also ice cold, is that a withdrawal thing? Cloudy head and jumpy jittery chicken sizzle muscles, no appetite so I'm weak, and holy crap, does anyone else have a backache from hell?
I got dizzy and nauseous and angry, I felt attacked (which is nuts).
Hold on guys, we can kick this shit!
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much.
When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
I'm so weak, it's been years. But I'm walking a bit, I take the stairs, I stretch.

I was hungry today for the first time in ages, really hungry. I ate through half a box of crackers and two apples, some cheese, and I can't stop drinking water. It's like my body WANTS to get better now.
I'm doing it, guys, one day at a time. ... And I plan to be one super-sober traveller, apart from maybe an occasional glass of wine,
I didn't even think to bring a damn Advil in my bag. I typed 120wpm for, barring four 3-5min breaks, eight HOURS today.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin.
None
I do not want to be a junkie thank you very much.
By the time the conversation was over I wanted to be drunk or high, god I was frustrated.
I think about using and reason it out. It makes no sense to go back.
I am still weak, it's a long road back. I think about using sometimes, I do recognize that I am not immune to that pull.
I genuinely lost track. Life got busy, and I'm okay, and I've thought about it, and been tempted, but I'm still here.
I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly. I just... live.

Yesterday was my 4 years sober... It started one day at a time and being honest and telling on myself.

I want more than anything to be free from these chemical shackles. So that is exactly what I am going to do.

I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life. And this goes out to anyone out there who knows they need to bite the bullet. I PROMISE you, that not being chained to a pill or strip or powder is the way to go.
So my advice is do not use sub long term unless your ready and willing to taper very slowly and truly have the self control to do so.

To anyone out there who is on day 1 week 1 week 2 etc. I know how INSURMOUNTABLE it seems. But I PROMISE YOU if you just STAY THE FUCK AWAY FROM OPIATES, and have a vision of what you want your life to look like. It WILL fall into place.
Long story short, it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family.
I ran out of my meds soon after I got out and am continuing to heal up, find a job and change my life around. It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober.
I never get withdrawals; I use to but got past the worst of my addiction and now I only use two times a week give or take a day.
I have been for about 6 years everyday.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Man did I enjoy that time and I look back on that as what I want for my life, I have my biochemistry degree now but working at a call center to save up and move to a region that has better careers for my passion. I am now quitting again after screwing around, going to rehab and getting out only to get arrested for a dui cause i passed out in my car after shooting up.
I am now 23 and feel like I need to get it right this time; I know I do not want to pick up.

Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy.
I started a real program today. It's my first day sober, again. Feeling good about this time though.
This is my first sober weekend so I'm staying busy. Getting some lunch with friends in a bit, and going with a friend to his home group tonight.
I'm really bored. Just counting down the hours till my 8 o clock meeting.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I haven't been sick in years, at least I haven't felt sick, other than withdrawals, in years.
It's day 20 for me. Tomorrow will be 3 weeks sober, which is incredible to me. This is already the most real clean time I've ever had without using illicit substances.
What have you done for your recovery this weekend?
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah! Mom took me out to dinner to celebrate which was pretty cool. I'm clean another day and thankful for that!

I know I can stay sober one more day, and it's my hope you all will too! ... I've really grown to love my home group! ... I had extra money because when I went to pay for my IOP after group today I found out I had an almost $350 credit with my rehab which should easily cover the rest of the month. It was really nice not thinking, "oh I've got dope money!" but rather I'm going to go walk around the mall and get a coffee.

But, I am clean, and life is good! Weather you're just starting off, restarting, or you have years of clean time, stay clean just for today. Don't give up on yourself, and keep your eye on that prize!
Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. This will be the first trip I have every taken sober, and I'm really looking forward to it.
I still can't get other how different life is now. I am in such a better place...
How are you doing today? Weather you have years, months, days, or hours clean or even if you just have the desire to stop using post up and tell us.
Anyway, it gets a lot easier. Life's so much fucking better now even on my worst days.

It really does get better, and you really don't have to use opiates anymore. Being sober isn't a cakewalk, and it's not all rainbows and unicorns all the time. But it's a fuck load better than using, for me at least.

If your on day 1 or just struggling just know that it gets so much better if you just stick it out and put in some effort. Also, know the only difference between an addict with 10 minutes, 10 days, 10 months, or 10 years of clean time is one bad choice.

I have no stance on complete abstinence one way or another. Some need to, some don't. I'm at home, winter has finally hit Ontario and I'm all like "don't make the call, don't make the call".

A lot of us who get clean and sober have this common experience of finding out who we really are as people.
My friend Kimberly is a really great writer, and she just posted her story on our blog about having 7 months.
Just sharing his story in case anyone here can relate!!

Life can get super hard in recovery, but it's possible to get through anything. Check out this article by my friend Aly about what her journey has been like for the past 4 years!
The concept of loving yourself is super important when getting clean.

Obviously, addiction and early sobriety can be really lonely sometimes. If you don't have people around who share their lives with you, maybe you can get a little bit of that feeling from reading something on our blog.
